items.text: length ball, HOlder gets under it and heaves it away to deep midwicket. Mehidy is down there and he tries going for the catch, with the ball always dying on him, and as a result he ends up with a sloppy misfield. Fifty for the WI captain
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Holder, 2 runs

items.text: b-e-a-utiful hit! Straight down the ground! Once again it's a length ball and Holder unleashes a full swing of his bat. No holding back. No need either
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Holder, SIX runs

items.text: thats the hundred partnership. Drives the full ball outside off, delivered from round the wicket, to long-off
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Holder, 1 run

items.text: caught behind! Toe-end of the bat as he goes for the pull shot and Bangladesh have a vital breakthrough at a great time. The angle from round the wicket means Hope is always hitting against it, and it might just have kept a little lower than he expected. Looked good for a third hundred in four ODIs, but he has to walk back now.
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hope, OUT

dismissal.text: SD Hope c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Mashrafe Mortaza 87 (172m 108b 6x4 1x6) SR: 80.55

items.text: tossed up on leg stump, he drives to long-on
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Holder, 1 run

items.preText: James: "Dav L: Sobers was rubbish at ODI's. Dropped after a single game in which he got a duck (this does involve a selective approach to facts). "
items.text: good length on off stump, Allen is playing for turn and that's dangerous against Shakib, because there rarely is any. Gets lucky with an inside edge that goes behind square leg
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Allen, 1 run

items.text: rocks back and punches a shortish delivery outside off to long-on
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Holder, 1 run

items.text: tossed up on off stump, drives to long-off
items.postText: James: "Shakib's first 8 overs (0/18) would look like good control in test cricket, let alone ODI's"
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Allen, 1 run

items.text: looks to slice the shortish delivery on off stump through the covers, but it slides into the right-hander and takes the inside edge
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Holder, no run

items.text: drives through the covers
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Holder, 1 run

items.text: whacks a length ball on leg stump to long-on. Only a single. Feels like a missed opportunity. Felt like it all innings
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Holder, 1 run

items.text: length ball wanders down leg side as Allen tries to lift it over backward square leg
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Allen, 1 wide

items.text: back of a length on off stump, defends
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Allen, no run

items.preText: Nitish: "@Mr. Al: Does ESPNCricinfo have an accessible archive on the number of dot balls bowled in an innings ? Bangladesh have bowled around 130 already. I am sure its nowhere near the record but which team holds the record ?" ---- Karthik Krishnaswamy actually has the answer. Or part of it anyway: We don't know the answer for all ODI cricket, but ever since ESPNcricinfo began recording ball-by-ball data (early 2000s), this Netherlands innings against Pakistan (255 dots) holds the record.
items.text: drives the full ball on off stump to cover
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Allen, no run

items.text: mis-hits a length ball outside off to mid-off
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Allen, 1 run

items.text: round the wicket for a length ball on the pads. Holder tries to swing it over midwicket. No luck
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Holder, no run

items.text: caught behind again! He didn't begin the day very well, but he's ending it #LikeABoss! This round the wicket angle is working a treat. Keeps cramping the right-handers. And on the odd occasion he takes the ball across them, they keep playing horizontal bat shots and nicking behind. Hope fell to the pull, Holder falls to the cut. West Indies have been poor in executing their big shots this innings. #Bizarre
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Holder, OUT

dismissal.text: JO Holder c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Mashrafe Mortaza 62 (85m 76b 3x4 1x6) SR: 81.57

items.text: tucks a good length ball to midwicket
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Allen, no run

items.text: defends a full ball on off stump
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Allen, no run

items.text: sweeps a length ball on off stump past the left of short fine leg. Nicely done
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Allen, FOUR runs

items.text: pins him in front. Lovely response from Shakib. The typical left-arm spinner's delivery. Angled in from round the wicket and straightening just enough that it strikes the pad and not the bat of a batsman playing for turn. Allen has a stride in, but this should hit the stump. Shave leg stump at least. Umpire Kettleborough seems to think so, at least but we don't have DRS in this series for confirmation of that
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Allen, OUT

dismissal.text: FA Allen lbw b Shakib Al Hasan 7 (12m 9b 1x4 0x6) SR: 77.77

items.text: first ball in ODI cricket and he goes back and dabs to point
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Reifer, no run

items.text: full on off stump, defends it
items.postText: West Indies have gone 32 for 3 in the last five overs. Their overall run-rate is only 4.68
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Reifer, no run

items.preText: Vinod Rajpal: "With Shakib's 10 over quota, he becomes the 2nd Bangladeshi to bowl 10,019 ODI deliveries.."
items.text: works it away to deep square leg
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Nurse, 2 runs

items.text: flicks it to deep midwicket
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Nurse, 2 runs
